result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Vincent Erno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Amy S.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26211717 in court 1x on 6/3/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Amy S. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Defendant Michael Vincent Erno in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is not prepared to plea today.  Court ordered matter be set for jury trial in Branch 24.  State withdraws offer.  Jury trial scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Vincent Erno in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties requests an adjournment of the plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Vincent Erno in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3-26-2015). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Ace World Wide.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael Vincent Erno in court.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
